# Coleman House (Lewes, Delaware)

| locmapin    = Delaware#USA
| built       = c.
| added       = April 11, 1977
| area        =
| refnum      = 77000392
}}
Coleman House is a historic home located at Lewes, Sussex County, Delaware. It dates to about 1815, and consists of a two-story, three-bay, frame main section with -story, frame wing.  Both sections are sheathed in cypress and have gable roofs.  It is an outstanding example of the early-19th-century rural architecture once common in the Lewes area.
It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1977.
